rdt.tree.splitter

Interface Splitter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActiveSplitter, ConstructableSplitter, UpdateableSplitter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FullNominalActivateSplitter, FullNominalSplitter, InstanceBasedNumericSplitter, LabelSplitter, NumericSplitter, QuantilSplitter, SparseSplitter, UpdateableFullNominalSplitter

    public interface Splitter
    Splitter Interface. The splitter is an essential element of a decision tree and is contained in each inner-node. With a splitter it is decided to which child-node the incoming instance will be forwarded.
    Author:
    MK

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canHandle(weka.core.Instance inst)
      Checks if this splitter can process the given instance.
      int determineChild(weka.core.Instance inst)
      Determines the number of the child-node to which the instance should be forwarded.
      int getNumberOfChilds()
      Returns the number of child-nodes to which the splitter can assign instances.
      SplitterType getType()
      Returns the type of the splitter.
      int[] getUsedAttributeIds()
      Returns all the attributes which are used to determine the child-node for a given instance.
      boolean isConstructable()
      Returns true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false.
      boolean isUpdateable()
      Returns true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false.

    • Method Detail

      • determineChild

        int determineChild(weka.core.Instance inst)
            throws RDTException
        Determines the number of the child-node to which the instance should be forwarded.
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance which will be forwarded
        Returns:
        the number of the child-node to which the instance will be forwarded
        Throws:
        RDTException

      • canHandle

        boolean canHandle(weka.core.Instance inst)
        Checks if this splitter can process the given instance. (e.g. If the the splitter checks on a missing value of the given instance this method return false)
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance which will be checked, if it can be processed by the splitter
        Returns:
        true if a child-node can be determined for the instance otherwise false

      • getNumberOfChilds

        int getNumberOfChilds()
        Returns the number of child-nodes to which the splitter can assign instances.
        Returns:
        the number of child-nodes

      • getUsedAttributeIds

        int[] getUsedAttributeIds()
                   throws RDTException
        Returns all the attributes which are used to determine the child-node for a given instance.
        Returns:
        the attributes which are used by the splitter
        Throws:
        RDTException

      • isUpdateable

        boolean isUpdateable()
        Returns true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false

      • isConstructable

        boolean isConstructable()
        Returns true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if the splitter can be updated otherwise false

      • getType

        SplitterType getType()
        Returns the type of the splitter.
